Lewis F. Powell, Jr. Archives 003

archdesc.runner: Lewis F. Powell, Jr. Archives, School of Law, Washington and Lee University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Lewis F. Powell, Jr. Archives, School of Law, Washington and Lee University
did.unittitle:
Washington and Lee University School of Law Collection
1849-2004
did.physdesc: This collection consists of 1 cubic foot of materials and one oversize folder housed in the map cases.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Washington and Lee University School of Law Collection, MS 003, Lewis F. Powell Jr. Archives, Lexington, VA

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection incorporates very small accessions received in no documentary context. All materials deal with the history of the School of Law at Washington and Lee University and its predecessor institutions, or with alumni of this law school.

In October 2016, the collection was reappraised. Some materials were removed to be placed on other collection or disposed of because they did not have continuing value. Box and folder numbers were assigned and decimal numbers were assigned to each descrete collection within this collection.

unittitle.title: The Booklet of the Great War Law Class of Nineteen Seventeen. Washington and Lee University
A Brief Biogaphy of Rosser Lynn Malone, Jr. and a Photo of Elizabeth Amis Malone
Morton Needs a View or Sherwood v. Walker Revisted

scopecontent.p: Law student Shannon Echols hand wrote and illustrated this work in the manner of Dr. Suess.

did.unittitle: Law Student Murdered Cadet -- Only Jury Was Hung, The Rockbridge AdvocateMarch 1995
Report Card of H. S. Larrick March 1897

unittitle.title: Autography of Judge Brokenbrough's Law Class of 1859-60

did.container: 1/10 & Faculty Photo Series in School of Law Archives

scopecontent.p: These materials, removed from crumbling scrapbook pages, were received in 1996 (accession # 96-2m) from Lewis Tyree, son of the collector of these items. Though Tyree served briefly on the law school faculty, these materials are from his time as a law student at Washington and Lee. There is one folder of printed invitations and programs. All other materials are photographs of students, faculty and events. Seven photos of law faculty members have been separated from this collection and filed in the law school archives faculty photo series.

did.unittitle: Law Lectures Delivered at Staunton, Virginia 1832

scopecontent.p: This file contains newspaper and magazine articles, and copies of correspondence documenting the life of John W. Brockenbrough, founder of the Lexington Law School. This material came in accession # 98m:002 from Mrs. D. Robert Copeland.

did.unittitle: Introductory Address to the Law Class of Lexington. Delivered in the Franklin Hall; October 31, 1849 by Judge John W. Brockenbrough. 1849

scopecontent.p: This copy was provided by the Harvard Law Library via interlibrary loan.

did.unittitle:
Memory Book, Washington & Lee University of F. J. Heazel.
1911-1912

scopecontent.p: These materials are pages from a scrapbook (accession #99M004) of F. J. Heazel, 1912 graduate of the W&L law school. Eleven leaves of the book remain including the cover. Photos, clippings, and memorabila are affixed to the pages. Some materials had been removed from the pages before the donations. Photos include views of the campus and town of Lexington.

did.unittitle: Death and Funeral of Sydney Lewis 1999
Class of 1949 Fiftieth Reunion Reminicences April 30, 1999
Interview with Judge Walter E. Hoffman November 17, 1994
did.physdesc: 1 audio cassette and 2 compact disc copies

did.unittitle: Investiture Ceremony for William F. Stone, Jr. As The United States Bankruptcy Judge For the Western District Of Virginia July 23, 1999

did.physdesc: One original and one photographic reproductions.

scopecontent.p: The original diploma of Oliver P. Evans (2002M:003)was given to the law school by Hayes McClerkin who had purchased it from an a dealer in Charleston, SC.

did.physdesc: 15 page letter to archivist John N. Jacob

scopecontent.p: Subjects of photos are U.S. Supreme Court Justices E.D. White, William Howard Taft, Harlan F. Stone, Oliver Wendell Holmes, and Charles E. Hughes. All photos are inscribed to Graham. Provenance is unknown. Photos may have arrived at Washington and Lee University with the Samuel J. Graham Papers now housed in Special Collections, Leyburn Library, Washington and Lee University.

did.physdesc: As executor of the estate of her sister, Lila Gayle Hyde Shore, Lucile Hyde Wehman sent the following items formerly belonging to George Decatur Shore, Jr. of the 1916 class of the Washington and Lee University School of Law: 3 editions of The Calyx- 1913, 1914 & 1916; 2 Washington and Lee law diplomas - 1916 Bachelor of Laws and 1969 change to Juris Doctor; 3 photos - unidentified group of young men, c. 1914, & 2 photos from Shore's 50th Washington and Lee class reunion, May 1966; laminated obituary clipping, 1981. The diplomas and c. 1914 photo will be stored in the 003 Washington and Lee University Law School Collection oversize folder in the map case. The Calyxsare stored with the other yearbooks.

did.unittitle: Washington and Lee University Law Commencement Video Recording(2005M:002), May 8, 2004
did.physdesc: CD-R record of commencement exercise. Recorded and donated by John Eisinger.

scopecontent.p: Materials are: Letter: John L. Campbell to W. D. Kibler, August 17, 1896. Letter: A. P. Carter to W. D. Kibler, Sept. 10, 1897 Letter: B. R. Kibler to W. D. Kibler, Jan. 29, 1898. These materials, donated by Sharon Hanger Sproul, 41 Woodland Drive, Staunton, VA 24401, came from the estate of her parents, James Brown Hanger, Jr. and Mildred VanPelt Hanger.

Found item, possibly formerly housed with rare books before their move to archives. Approximately 12" x 8" x .75" printed notebook with printed label "Law Notes Washington and Lee University" on the front cover. Notes appear to be from the 19th century, when compared to dated notes. Notes seem to have been made from reading books, rather than from lectures. There are no identifying markings (excepting "Vol. IV" written on inside cover) indicating who made the notes. There are 319 pages. Notes are made through p. 317, mostly on the right hand side of opened volume.

The 2013-14 editor-in-chief of the Washington and Lee Law Review, Thomas Short, found this volume and gave it to the archives. The creators of the law review, apparently bound reprints of Washington and Lee University Law faculty articles previously published in other law reviews, and the recent cases, notes and book reviews from Kentucky Law Jourrnal, vol. XVII, no. 4, as dummy text when designing the law review format.

unittitle.title: Poetry on the Wings of the Morning: Selected Works of John Charles Thomas, 1967-2011

scopecontent.p: This is a copyof retired Virginia Supreme Court Justice John Charles Thomas self published book of his poems, Poetry on the Wings of the Morning. Thomas was Powell Lecturer on April 4, 2016. He gave this book, with its dedication and enclosed note, to Washington and Lee University Dean of the College and English Professor Suzanne Keen. She gave it to the Powell Archives.
